meanings.definition: To go to see or spend time with (someone) socially
meanings.sent1: I will visit my friend after school today.
meanings.sent2: She likes to visit her grandparents on weekends.
meanings.sent3: Why don't we visit the park and have a picnic?
meanings.sent4: Laughter always visits when friends come together.
meanings.sent5: The idea of a surprise visit made her smile.

meanings.definition: To go to a place for a short time for a specific purpose
meanings.sent1: We need to visit the grocery store to buy milk.
meanings.sent2: He will visit the library to return his books.
meanings.sent3: Let's visit the beach for some fresh air.
meanings.sent4: Inspiration often visits when we least expect it.
meanings.sent5: The urge to visit the mountains grew stronger each day.

meanings.definition: An act of going to see a person or place for a short time for a specific purpose
meanings.sent1: My visit to the doctor was quick and informative.
meanings.sent2: The visit to the museum was educational and fun.
meanings.sent3: The unexpected visit from a squirrel in the garden surprised us all.
meanings.sent4: His visit to the past through old photographs brought back memories.
meanings.sent5: The visit to the zoo left the children full of excitement.
